channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: George Floyd's death at the hands of Minneapolis police has sparked widespread riots in the United States with more than 40 cities in lockdown as demonstrators continue to clash with police.
item.title: George Floyd protests LIVE updates: Donald Trump threatens US military intervention as autopsy reveals Floyd's cause of death was 'asphyxiation from applied pressure'

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Western United and Macarthur FC, the A-League's 11th and 12th teams, are the subject of seperate actions in the Federal Circuit Court.
item.title: A-League expansion clubs taken to court by former employees

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: NSW lifts COVID-19 restrictions on gyms, junior sport; Palaszczuk issues apology over Nathan Turner death as Australian death toll stands at 102

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.description: Child rape charges have been dropped against male members of the infamous Colt family before the men were due to face trial.
item.title: NSW prosecutors drop child rape charges in Colt incest family case

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: "Realigning ourselves in the world, changing that relationship with China, it's not a cost-free thing to do, I'm being very honest about that," Farage said.
item.title: Farage wants tougher stance on China, says Trump needed to 'stop it'

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The state opposition has lashed child safety minister Di Farmer and the state government over the death of the Caboolture toddler.
item.title: 'Hang their heads in shame': No sackings after Mason Lee death

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Marilyn Figueroa says those protesting against the death of George FloydÂ have been treated much more harshly than armed demonstrators at anti-lockdown rallies.
item.title: "People were panicked and tripping over": DC protesters fear worse to come

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: State bushfire-fighting efforts are being frustrated by the lack of an overarching national system to decide where firefighters, water-bombing aircraft and other resources are deployed during emergencies, the bushfire royal commission has heard.
item.title: Lack of 'national picture' hampering bushfire-fighting efforts

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Cricket Australia can expect another fight with its players if its financial projections for the coming summer are lower than expected.
item.title: Pay day: Cricketers set to fight if CA projections are not 'reasonable'

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: America's biggest cities have again descended into vandalism as governors condemn Trump's threat to unleash the US military to restore law and order.
item.title: Riots flare in New York, Washington and LA as Trump threatens to deploy military

item.description: Raid on Timothy Moran's Eltham home uncovered array of DIY firearms, two pipe bombs, ammunition, a nunchaku, machete, a dead cannabis plant and a bag of weed.
item.title: Drug grower jailed after makeshift gun factory found at his home

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: Victoria Cross recipient was involved in two more unlawful deaths in Afghanistan in 2012, fresh witness statements allege.
item.title: Ben Roberts-Smith involved in seven unlawful killings, witness statements allege

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: The battle for Virgin has come down to a clash of two titans: the Bostonians from Bain versus the late contender from Wall Street, Cyrus. Both have Richard Branson in common.
item.title: Forget Team Australia, Virgin will ultimately be owned by Americans

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The state's building watchdog suspended the licence of engineering arm of corporate giant Lendlease, but the company says the licence is not needed.
item.title: Lendlease Engineering has building licence suspended by QBCC

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Conservative crossbenchers have joined Labor and the Greens to defeat the Berejiklian government's wages policy in the upper house.
item.title: Berejiklian government's push to freeze public servant wages blocked

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: The state government insists it wonât be rushed into a decision about a return to play timeline for local football despite pressure from AFL Victoria.
item.title: Health must be top priority, minister tells impatient AFL Victoria

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: The return of the former Victorian president of the Comancheros, Amad 'Jay' Malkoun, is expected to inflame tensions with his successor and between rival gangs.
item.title: Ex-bikie boss' return to Melbourne set to inflame tensions

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The government-owned wholesale broadband provider has been taken to task by the competition regulator for giving TransACT customers a bum steer.
item.title: NBN misled customers in Canberra on network switch

item.description: The former Dally M Medallist played through pain in the second half of the Cowboys win over the Gold Coast and scans have revealed some bone bruising.
item.title: Huge blow for Cowboys as Taumalolo ruled out of Sharks clash

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: Theatre companies welcome the prospect of a targeted live performance rescue package, but say they can't reopen under current social distancing rules.
item.title: 'Let us open our theatres,' companies ask government

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: The publicity-shy designer was uncompromising on high quality clothing and counted NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian as a loyal customer.
item.title: 'An icon and trailblazer': Australian fashion designer Anna Thomas dies

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: Australia's dollar has returned to average levels after hitting 17-year lows just six weeks ago.
item.title: US70Â¢ in sight as Aussie dollar hits four-month high

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Amid mass riots in the US, families of Aboriginal people who have died in custody say Australians need to look no further than their own backyard.
item.title: George Floyd death in custody highlights Australia's 'shameful' record

item.description: Warning that Victoria may see a spike in COVID-19 and other viruses next week.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: One hundred workers are continuing the clean-up effort despite gale-force winds and hazardous surf conditions being forecast.
item.title: Shipping containers found in NSW, but authorities 'have a big job ahead'

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Scores of brumby supporters rallied on the steps of Victoria's State Parliament against a culling program that could start within weeks.
item.title: Protesters keep up fight to save brumbies in high country

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: The fate of Carriageworks rests with the Berejiklian government and a crucial creditors' meeting next week.
item.title: Carriageworks revival plan revealed as philanthropists offer support

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: A disgraced former police officer whose conviction for assaulting a teenager was overturned is taking Victoria Police to court to compel the force to reinstate him.
item.title: Police officer who punched teen in face suing force to get reinstated

item.description: Classique Legend has something of a namesake in Dundeel three-year-old Legend Has It, while Les Bridge's other gelding appears just as promising.
item.title: Legend Has It could become real deal at Randwick

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on a seven-race card on the Kensington track.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Randwick on Wednesday

item.description: Officials in some US cities say the protests are also being inflamed by white agitators.
item.title: Tablet interactive: US riots

item.description: Des Headland reacts to the death of George Floyd and writes it's hard for anyone who has not experienced racism to understand it. For people of colour, he writes, racism can destroy any semblance of self-worth in a split second.
item.title: Australia is no different to America when it comes to people of colour

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Seek co-founder Paul Bassat says the social media giant's failure to pay significant tax in Australia underscores the need for more home grown technology startups.
item.title: Seek co-founder Paul Bassat criticises Facebook's tax dodge

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: A former drug counsellor who traded fees for drugs and obtained cocaine from people under his care has pleaded guilty to perverting the course of justice and drug trafficking.
item.title: Drug counsellor who abused position to buy cocaine for grandson pleads guilty

item.description: Her bones were among 110 skeletal remains of people who lived in a region of blossoming civilisation running from Turkey through Iran between 7500 and 3000 years ago.
item.title: 'Lady in the well' sheds light on ancient human population movements

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Australia's relationship with the US is being tested by the escalating chaos raging across the country and Donald Trump's invitation to join an expanded G7.
item.title: Scott Morrison asks Washington embassy to investigate attack on Australian TV crew

item.dc:creator: Genevieve Rota
item.description: TV has become a companion to many during the shutdowns. But what shows did everyone tune into while they were isolating?
item.title: How The Last Dance became a cultural touchstone during lockdown

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: The problems that provoked rioting in the US have parallels here in Australia.
item.title: Australia not immune from US-style racial tension

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Rugby Australia has put up its hand to host the Rugby Championship under bubble conditions, while there is growing belief a four-game trans-Tasman series can be held.
item.title: RA confident Bledisloe Cup series, Rugby Championship still on cards

item.description: This week on the Real Footy podcast, Jake Niall, Caroline Wilson and Sam McClure talk about the state of the game today and how it compares to footy from decades past.
item.title: Real Footy podcast: How long will footy be able to hold onto its unique traits?

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: It was a tale of two cities in State Parliament on Tuesday as the Premier and Opposition Leader did battle over the controversial Belt and Road deal.
item.title: Andrews says he won't lecture Beijing nor take orders from Canberra

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: In a scathing judgment, the court found Joe Ludwig made the ban order "shutting his eyes to the risk that it might be invalid".
item.title: Former Labor minister acted unreasonably in 2011 Indonesia live cattle ban

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The decision is another blow to the joint-venture outfit as the pressure on coach Paul McGregor intensifies.
item.title: Suli snubs big-money Dragons deal to re-sign with Manly

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Incoming MLC chairman Robert Coombe says wealth managers must adapt quickly to sweeping changes that have been accelerated by the Hayne royal commission.
item.title: New MLC chair says adapting to post-Hayne world is vital

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: Crystal Shihada has been cleared of any criminal charges following investigation into why accused killer Ricardo Barbaro was found inside her luxury apartment.
item.title: No charges for Sydney woman after fugitive found in her penthouse

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: Health Minister Greg Hunt pumps more money into hydroxychloroquine research even though WHO paused its trial due to safety concerns.
item.title: Hunt gives $170k for controversial drug as other countries halt trials

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: COVID-19 and the riots in the US have not stopped the global ambitions of Afterpay rival Zip Co, which hasÂ acquired the 85 per cent of US provider QuadPay it doesn't yet own for $446 million.
item.title: Zip shares soar after US acquisition and $200 million funding deal

item.description: Formula One has a perfect opportunity to experiment with back-to-back races in Austria in July but champions Mercedes are standing in the way, said Red Bull boss Christian Horner.
item.title: Mercedes block move to modify F1 race format

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Virgin Australia's administrators have picked US private equity giant Bain Capital and the Richard Branson-linked firm Cyrus Capital as the final two bidders vying to buy and relaunch the collapsed airline.
item.title: Bain and Branson-linked Cyrus final two in race to buy Virgin
